Detailed Description

Launch Specification.

Member Function Documentation

- (void EC2LaunchSpecification.)addAllSecurityGroup: (EC2GroupIdentifier *)  allSecurityGroup  

Adds a single object to allSecurityGroups.

This function will alloc and init allSecurityGroups if not already done.

- (void EC2LaunchSpecification.)addBlockDeviceMapping: (EC2BlockDeviceMapping *)  blockDeviceMapping  

Adds a single object to blockDeviceMappings.

This function will alloc and init blockDeviceMappings if not already done.

- (NSString * EC2LaunchSpecification.)description  

Returns a string representation of this object; useful for testing and debugging.

Returns:
A string representation of this object.
- (id EC2LaunchSpecification.)init  

Default constructor for a new object.

Callers should use the property methods to initialize this object after creating it.

Property Documentation

- (NSMutableArray *) blockDeviceMappings [read, write, retain]

Specifies how block devices are exposed to the instance.

Each mapping is made up of a virtualName and a deviceName.

- (NSString *) instanceType [read, write, retain]

Specifies the instance type.

Constraints:
Allowed Values: t1.micro, m1.small, m1.large, m1.xlarge, m2.xlarge, m2.2xlarge, m2.4xlarge, c1.medium, c1.xlarge, cc1.4xlarge, cg1.4xlarge

- (NSString *) ramdiskId [read, write, retain]

Specifies the ID of the RAM disk to select.

Some kernels require additional drivers at launch. Check the kernel requirements for information on whether or not you need to specify a RAM disk and search for the kernel ID.

- (NSString *) userData [read, write, retain]

Optional data, specific to a user's application, to provide in the launch request.

All instances that collectively comprise the launch request have access to this data. User data is never returned through API responses.
